1.definition: an area within which distinction or resolution is difficult or uncertain [the public-private ]

2.definition: an extension of protection, reach, application, or considerationa body of rights held to be guaranteed by implication from other rights explicitly enumerated in the U.S. Constitution [the First Amendment has a where privacy is protected from governmental intrusion ", 381 U.S. 479 (1965)"] see alsoin the Important Cases section
